<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>They did it. Four amateur astronauts blasted into space last night on SpaceX's Inspiration4 mission, becoming the first all-civilian crew to travel to orbit. They're expected to splash down off the coast of Florida in three days.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In other space news, NASA astronaut Mark Vande Hei got his stay aboard the ISS extended to 353 days, which would be the longest spaceflight ever recorded by an American. Makes sense, who would want to give up that Zoom background? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">—<em>Jamie Wilde, Matty Merritt, Neal Freyman</em></p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
DELIVERY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/15/food-delivery-apps-suing-nyc-cities?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
DoorDash Starts a Food Fight
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/15/food-delivery-apps-suing-nyc-cities?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="DoorDash pickup" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83NDMxL2Rvb3JkYXNoX3BpY2t1cC5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Jeff Greenberg/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">These days, food delivery apps have more suits than Barney Stinson.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">DoorDash sued New York City yesterday over a law that would make the delivery app share customer data—including names, emails, phone numbers, and delivery addresses—with the restaurants fulfilling its orders. And that’s <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/doordash-sues-new-york-city-over-sharing-data-with-restaurants-11631711461?mod=hp_lista_pos3" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the second time</a> DoorDash sued NYC...this week.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The other lawsuit, which saw DoorDash, GrubHub, and Uber Eats join forces, concerns commission caps, or the percentage of a food order’s total that delivery apps can charge restaurants for their services.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Some background:</strong> Pre-pandemic, apps reportedly <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/22/no-winners-delivery-app-food-fight?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">charged restaurants</a> 20%–40% per order. But when Covid-19 shut down in-person dining, restaurants were forced to rely on delivery. So NYC, plus San Francisco, Chicago, and several other cities, imposed commission caps to help keep restaurants afloat and the dream of sizzling fajitas alive.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The NYC law that apps are fighting limits them to charging 15% of an order’s total for delivery and 5% for other services, like in-app advertising.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>What delivery apps like DoorDash are angry about is that leaders in NYC and SF traced over their commission cap laws in Sharpie even after restaurants reopened.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It’s part of a bigger battle between apps and regulators</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Chicago sued DoorDash in August for adding a “Chicago Fee” to orders, implying to customers that the city introduced an extra charge. It also went after GrubHub for other allegedly </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/27/chicago-sues-doordash-grubhub-for-allegedly-deceiving-customers.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">deceptive practices</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Portland, OR, is facing a </span><span><a href="https://www.foodandwine.com/news/delivery-apps-refuse-to-comply-with-portland-fee-caps?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">similar problem</a></span><span>: UberEats added a “City of Portland Ordinance” fee, while DoorDash added a “Portland City Mandate.”</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Food delivery is a brutally tough biz, and even during the pandemic boom times those companies remained unprofitable. More helicopter parenting from cities could threaten their long-term viability even more.<em>—JW</em></p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMBLING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/15/casino-stocks-plunge-fears-crackdown-macau?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Fear and Loathing in Macau
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Wynn in Macau" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83NDM0L3d5bm5faW5fbWFjYXUucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Chris Mcgrath/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As part of its dramatic quest to reshape its consumer culture, the Chinese government is now taking aim at Macau, the largest gambling market in the world. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What happened: </strong>The government of Macau, a special administrative region of China, said it would kick off a <a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/macau-kicks-off-public-gaming-consultation-ahead-casino-rebidding-2021-09-15/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">45-day consultation period</a> for the industry, which investors fear could lead to tighter restrictions and...less gambling. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Gaming stocks are going to have to hit the ATM, because they got wiped out.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A Bloomberg index of the six Macau casino operators </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-09-14/macau-casinos-downgraded-by-jpmorgan-as-relicensing-begins?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">plummeted 23%</a></span><span>, the biggest one-day fall on record. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>US casino stocks with exposure to Macau, such as Wynn, also tumbled yesterday.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Macau is to Las Vegas as Las Vegas is to Atlantic City. Macau’s casinos rake in around <a href="https://www.thestreet.com/markets/las-vegas-sands-wynn-stock-slump-as-macau-takes-aim-at-casinos?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$37 billion in annual revenue</a>, roughly 5x more than the Vegas Strip. But this crackdown couldn’t have come at a worse time for Macau, when revenue is already down ~80% from pre-pandemic levels. —<em>NF</em></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
STARTUPS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/15/canva-becomes-fifthmost-valuable-private-startup-world?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Canva Drags and Drops Its Way into the Top Five
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When we needed our hot takes to be cute and Instagrammable, Canva was there with its Futura font and pastel backgrounds. Now, after <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-australia-58567722?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raising</a> $200 million at a $40 billion valuation, the Australian company is the world’s fifth-most valuable private startup—sandwiching itself between Klarna ($45.6 billion) and Instacart ($39 billion).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Canva, which launched in 2013 with a free service, started out as the go-to design platform for small businesses and anyone who wanted to make trendy posters, but it has since added paid versions for power users and companies. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Canva has 60+ million monthly active users in 190 countries, and companies like Salesforce, Marriott, and PayPal all use its enterprise plan.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Two of the company's founders, CEO Melanie Perkins and COO Cliff Obrecht, also said yesterday that they’d <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/alexkonrad/2021/09/14/canva-raises-at-40-billion-valuation-and-founders-pledge-away-their-wealth/?sh=1db00dba7ba9" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">donate</a> most of their combined 36% stake in the company to charity. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Canva will use the new funding to double its 2,000-person staff over the next year and expand into web design and video editing tools. —<em>MM</em></p>

<img alt="YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK,WY - JUNE 08: Visitors watch bison and their n..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83NDIzL3llbGxvd3N0b25lX3NlZXNfcmVjb3JkX24uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>William Campbell/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat:</strong> Yellowstone National Park is turning into a zoo...of humans. More people <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/09/15/us/yellowstone-park-visitors.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">visited</a> the park last month—921,844—than in any August on record, park officials said. That’s a 4.5% bump from last August and a 12% increase from 2019.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“To be clear, I blame Larry Nassar, but I also blame an entire system that enabled and perpetrated his abuse.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Simone Biles and other American gymnasts <a href="https://twitter.com/MSNBC/status/1438153648689844225?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">testified</a> at a Senate hearing around the FBI’s (mis)handling of sexual abuse allegations against former USA Gymnastics team doctor, Larry Nassar. Nassar is serving what amounts to a life sentence in prison.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Watch: </strong>An excellent back-to-office video. (<a href="https://twitter.com/juliahobsbawm/status/1436355265671143427?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Julia Hobsbawm on Twitter</a>)</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CYBERSECURITY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/15/microsoft-goes-completely-passwordless?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Future Is Passwordless
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/15/microsoft-goes-completely-passwordless?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Fingerprint on a 3D Microsoft logo" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83NDI5L21pY3Jvc29mdF9maW5nZXJwcmludF9sb2dvLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><em>Francis Scialabba</em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Microsoft <a href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/computing/microsoft-now-lets-you-scrap-your-password-for-outlook-xbox-and-other-online-services/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> that all of its accounts, from Outlook to Xbox, can now be accessed without a password. Which means you’ll be able to log in by using some combo of fingerprint/facial recognition, Microsoft’s authenticator app, and a verification code sent to your email.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This is years in the making. In 2018, Microsoft <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2018/11/20/18104376/microsoft-account-no-password-windows-hello-fido2-support?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launched</a> its first version of passwordless logins so people could ditch the old sticky-notes-taped-to-the-laptop storage method. Since then, 200+ million users have opted to live the password-free lifestyle, according to the company.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Other tech giants, like Google and Apple, have also been working on passwordless authentication to beef up security on their own accounts—because while it’s more convenient to scan your finger for email access, it’s also more secure.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Hackers have a much easier time breaking into your email when you’ve been using slightly altered versions of “Blink182Luver” as a password for the last seven years. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It’s much harder to swipe a user’s fingerprint or a code sent directly to their phone.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Microsoft said that the rapid shift to digital during the pandemic accelerated its timeline for the rollout. —<em>MM</em></p>

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brew Mini:</strong> Got this one done in :25. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/15/brew-mini-workspace?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Can you beat that</a>? </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Three Headlines and a Lie</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Three of these news headlines are real and one is faker than the phrase, “Sure, I’ll help you move.” Can you guess the odd one out?<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Lord of the Rings actors </span><span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2021/sep/14/lord-of-the-rings-actors-praise-italian-man-who-lives-as-a-hobbit?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">praise Italian man</a></span><span> who lives as a hobbit</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The toilet-paper startup Who Gives a Crap just </span><span><a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/toilet-paper-startup-who-gives-a-crap-raises-30-million-2021-9?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raised $30 million</a></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Bookstore </span><span><a href="https://media2.giphy.com/media/OtNdXFIHx759p4enBX/giphy.gif?cid=ecf05e47di850j2b8aiwxqrk9gxtean64aor7kbvpef8dbp2&rid=giphy.gif&ct=g" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">boycotts</a></span><span> new Sally Rooney novel so staff doesn’t have to interact with ‘sad people’</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Massachusetts calls on the National Guard to </span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/09/15/1037307027/massachusetts-calls-national-guard-school-bus-driver-shortage-baker?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">mitigate</a></span><span> a school bus driver shortage.</span>
</li>
</ol>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83NDMxL2Rvb3JkYXNoX3BpY2t1cC5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eJeff Greenberg/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThese days, food delivery apps have more suits than Barney Stinson.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDoorDash sued New York City yesterday over a law that would make the delivery app share customer data—including names, emails, phone numbers, and delivery addresses—with the restaurants fulfilling its orders. And that’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/doordash-sues-new-york-city-over-sharing-data-with-restaurants-11631711461?mod=hp_lista_pos3\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe second time\u003c/a\u003e DoorDash sued NYC...this week.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe other lawsuit, which saw DoorDash, GrubHub, and Uber Eats join forces, concerns commission caps, or the percentage of a food order’s total that delivery apps can charge restaurants for their services.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSome background:\u003c/strong\u003e Pre-pandemic, apps reportedly \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/22/no-winners-delivery-app-food-fight?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003echarged restaurants\u003c/a\u003e 20%–40% per order. But when Covid-19 shut down in-person dining, restaurants were forced to rely on delivery. So NYC, plus San Francisco, Chicago, and several other cities, imposed commission caps to help keep restaurants afloat and the dream of sizzling fajitas alive.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe NYC law that apps are fighting limits them to charging 15% of an order’s total for delivery and 5% for other services, like in-app advertising.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhat delivery apps like DoorDash are angry about is that leaders in NYC and SF traced over their commission cap laws in Sharpie even after restaurants reopened.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIt’s part of a bigger battle between apps and regulators\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eChicago sued DoorDash in August for adding a “Chicago Fee” to orders, implying to customers that the city introduced an extra charge. It also went after GrubHub for other allegedly \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/27/chicago-sues-doordash-grubhub-for-allegedly-deceiving-customers.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edeceptive practices\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003ePortland, OR, is facing a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.foodandwine.com/news/delivery-apps-refuse-to-comply-with-portland-fee-caps?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esimilar problem\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e: UberEats added a “City of Portland Ordinance” fee, while DoorDash added a “Portland City Mandate.”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eFood delivery is a brutally tough biz, and even during the pandemic boom times those companies remained unprofitable. More helicopter parenting from cities could threaten their long-term viability even more.\u003cem\u003e—JW\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs part of its dramatic quest to reshape its consumer culture, the Chinese government is now taking aim at Macau, the largest gambling market in the world. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat happened: \u003c/strong\u003eThe government of Macau, a special administrative region of China, said it would kick off a \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/business/macau-kicks-off-public-gaming-consultation-ahead-casino-rebidding-2021-09-15/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e45-day consultation period\u003c/a\u003e for the industry, which investors fear could lead to tighter restrictions and...less gambling. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGaming stocks are going to have to hit the ATM, because they got wiped out.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eA Bloomberg index of the six Macau casino operators \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-09-14/macau-casinos-downgraded-by-jpmorgan-as-relicensing-begins?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplummeted 23%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, the biggest one-day fall on record. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUS casino stocks with exposure to Macau, such as Wynn, also tumbled yesterday.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eMacau is to Las Vegas as Las Vegas is to Atlantic City. Macau’s casinos rake in around \u003ca href=\"https://www.thestreet.com/markets/las-vegas-sands-wynn-stock-slump-as-macau-takes-aim-at-casinos?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$37 billion in annual revenue\u003c/a\u003e, roughly 5x more than the Vegas Strip. But this crackdown couldn’t have come at a worse time for Macau, when revenue is already down ~80% from pre-pandemic levels. —\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMicrosoft \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnet.com/tech/computing/microsoft-now-lets-you-scrap-your-password-for-outlook-xbox-and-other-online-services/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e that all of its accounts, from Outlook to Xbox, can now be accessed without a password. Which means you’ll be able to log in by using some combo of fingerprint/facial recognition, Microsoft’s authenticator app, and a verification code sent to your email.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis is years in the making. In 2018, Microsoft \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2018/11/20/18104376/microsoft-account-no-password-windows-hello-fido2-support?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elaunched\u003c/a\u003e its first version of passwordless logins so people could ditch the old sticky-notes-taped-to-the-laptop storage method. Since then, 200+ million users have opted to live the password-free lifestyle, according to the company.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eOther tech giants, like Google and Apple, have also been working on passwordless authentication to beef up security on their own accounts—because while it’s more convenient to scan your finger for email access, it’s also more secure.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHackers have a much easier time breaking into your email when you’ve been using slightly altered versions of “Blink182Luver” as a password for the last seven years. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt’s much harder to swipe a user’s fingerprint or a code sent directly to their phone.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eMicrosoft said that the rapid shift to digital during the pandemic accelerated its timeline for the rollout. —\u003cem\u003eMM\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS
